nodes.bodyText: Does listStatus just return the entire array/list? How does this stream anything when the result is already just a list/array?

listStatus returns an iterator where each element of this iterator is a list. This is the recommended way to implement streaming server gRPC calls. e.g., the RPC returns  something like [a,b, ...], [c,d, ...] depending on the batch size.
Note that, in the original implementation of client-side listStatus
https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/pull/12315/files#diff-f0b3f5c51c2e3e48833beccd832c5a63de3d74b8d195d9da564c99c299f50288R229-R237
We create an extra list and add each element in [a,b,...]  and [c,d,...] to this list before return to cli, which increased the resource overhead as well as latency.
@gpang

In other words, Alluxio master is already streaming results to client. however, we are not taking advantage of this streaming API given that in RetryHandlingFileSystemMasterClient.java, we will simply wait until all results are streamed from master before returning to client API callers, causing overhead in resource (e.g., memory pressure) and latency. Now we directly wrap the stream of status (may still in transmission) to client so they are able to proceed with partially transmitted results.
Ahhh, I see. I didn't realize that listStatus returned an Iterator.

I think these comments are stale, mentioning lists?
Also, is this one now preferred? Maybe we should comment on the differences/tradeoffs between this one and the standard listStatus

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -362,6 +363,35 @@ URIStatus getStatus(AlluxioURI path, GetStatusPOptions options)
   List<URIStatus> listStatus(AlluxioURI path, ListStatusPOptions options)
       throws FileDoesNotExistException, IOException, AlluxioException;
 
+  /**
+   * If the path is a directory, returns the {@link URIStatus} of all the direct entries in it.
+   * Otherwise returns a list with a single {@link URIStatus} element for the file.
+   *
+   * @param path the path to list information about
+   * @return a list of {@link URIStatus}s containing information about the files and directories
+   *         which are children of the given path
+   * @throws FileDoesNotExistException if the given path does not exist
+   */
+  default Stream<URIStatus> listStatusInStream(AlluxioURI path)
+      throws FileDoesNotExistException, IOException, AlluxioException {
+    return listStatus(path, ListStatusPOptions.getDefaultInstance()).stream();
+  }
+
+  /**
+   * If the path is a directory, returns the {@link URIStatus} of all the direct entries in it.
+   * Otherwise returns a list with a single {@link URIStatus} element for the file.

nodes.bodyText:
I'm not sure what is best practice, but should we be returning a Iterator, Iterable or Stream?
I'm also not sure about the name. Maybe some alternatives are listStatusStream or listStatusAsStream?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -154,6 +155,15 @@ void createDirectory(AlluxioURI path, CreateDirectoryPOptions options)
   List<URIStatus> listStatus(AlluxioURI path, ListStatusPOptions options)
       throws AlluxioStatusException;
 
+  /**
+   * @param path the path to list
+   * @param options the listStatus options
+   * @return the stream of file information for the given path
+   * @throws NotFoundException if the path does not exist
+   */
+  Stream<URIStatus> listStatusInStream(AlluxioURI path, ListStatusPOptions options)

nodes.bodyText:
Stream seems more favorable as I did some research
listStatusAsStream looks good to me

+   * @param options the listStatus options

nodes.bodyText: There is a tradeoff for this recursive listing. We could be locking more of the tree for longer with the recursive listing (especially if the sync interval was triggered)

but it is more 'correct' as you are guaranteed to have a 'snapshot' of a dir, versus dealing with contentions.
also this can save RPC cost on master side which IMO can offset the locking overhead.
Do we want this to be "ListStatusAsStream"?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -234,6 +238,23 @@ public long getNewBlockIdForFile(final AlluxioURI path)
     }, RPC_LOG, "ListStatus", "path=%s,options=%s", path, options);
   }
 
+  @Override
+  public Stream<URIStatus> listStatusAsStream(
+      final AlluxioURI path, final ListStatusPOptions options)
+      throws AlluxioStatusException {
+    return retryRPC(
+        () -> StreamSupport
+            .stream(
+                Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(
+                    mClient.listStatus(ListStatusPRequest.newBuilder()
+                        .setPath(getTransportPath(path)).setOptions(options).build()),
+                    Spliterator.ORDERED),
+                false)
+            .flatMap(pListStatusResponse -> pListStatusResponse.getFileInfosList().stream()
+                .map(pFileInfo -> new URIStatus(GrpcUtils.fromProto(pFileInfo)))),
+        RPC_LOG, "ListStatus", "path=%s,options=%s", path, options);

nodes.bodyText: the RPC is still the same. I was not adding any new RPCs
